javadoc: The ProgramMergeFilter is used to specify which portions of a program should be merged into another program. It indicates the types of program differences to merge. Each merge type can have its filter set to IGNORE or REPLACE. IGNORE indicates no interest in replacing or merging that type of difference. REPLACE indicates to replace differences in program1 with differences of that type from program2. Some merge types (for example, COMMENTS and SYMBOLS) allow the filter to be set to MERGE. MERGE indicates that the type should be taken from Program2 and merged into Program1 with whatever is alreaady there.

methods.javadoc: Creates new ProgramMergeFilter with none of the merge types selected.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramMergeFilter with none of the merge types selected.

methods.javadoc: Creates new ProgramMergeFilter that is equal to the specified ProgramMergeFilter.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramMergeFilter that is equal to the specified ProgramMergeFilter.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramMergeFilter with the specified merge types selected.

params.name: type
params.comment: the type of difference to look for between the programs.

params.name: filter
params.comment:
IGNORE, REPLACE, or MERGE. Indicates 
 which program difference to include of the specified type.
 If a particular type cannot be set to MERGE then it will be set to REPLACE.

methods.javadoc:
getFilter determines whether or not the specified type of filter is set.
 Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA,
 SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS.
 INVALID is returned if combinations of merge types (e.g. ALL) are 
 passed in.
@param type the merge type.
@return IGNORE, REPLACE, or MERGE. INVALID if parameter is a combination of 
 types or not a predefined primary type.
methods.name: getFilter
methods.comment:
getFilter determines whether or not the specified type of filter is set.
 Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA,
 SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS.
 INVALID is returned if combinations of merge types (e.g. ALL) are 
 passed in.

return.comment:
IGNORE, REPLACE, or MERGE. INVALID if parameter is a combination of 
 types or not a predefined primary type.

methods.name: validatePredefinedType
methods.comment:
validatePredefinedType determines whether or not the indicated type
 of filter item is a valid predefined type.
 Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA,
 SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS, ALL.

params.name: type
params.comment: the type of difference to look for between the programs.

return.comment: true if this is a pre-defined merge type.

methods.javadoc:
Determines if at least one of the filter types is set to REPLACE or MERGE.
@return true if at least one type is set.
methods.name: isSet
methods.comment: Determines if at least one of the filter types is set to REPLACE or MERGE.

return.comment: true if at least one type is set.

methods.javadoc: setFilter specifies whether or not the indicated type of item will not be included by the filter (IGNORE), replaced in the first program using the type of item in the second program (REPLACE), or included from both programs (MERGE). Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA, REFERENCES, SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS, ALL, or combinations of these "OR"ed together. if MERGE is not valid for an included primary type, then it will be set to REPLACE instead for that primary type. @param type the type(s) of difference(s) to include. @param filter IGNORE, REPLACE, or MERGE. Indicates whether to include none, one, or both programs' differences of the specified type.
methods.name: setFilter
methods.comment:
setFilter specifies whether or not the indicated type of item will
 not be included by the filter (IGNORE), replaced in the first program using the type of 
 item in the second program (REPLACE), or included from both programs (MERGE).
 Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA, REFERENCES,
 SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS, ALL, or combinations of
 these "OR"ed together.
 if MERGE is not valid for an included primary type, then it 
 will be set to REPLACE instead for that primary type.

params.name: type
params.comment: the type(s) of difference(s) to include.

params.name: filter
params.comment:
IGNORE, REPLACE, or MERGE. Indicates whether to include none, 
 one, or both programs' differences of the specified type.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a printable string indicating the current settings of this filter.
@return the current settings for this filter.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a printable string indicating the current settings of this filter.

return.comment: the current settings for this filter.

methods.name: getPrimaryTypes
methods.comment: Gets all the valid individual types of differences for this filter.

return.comment:
an array containing all the currently defined primary difference 
 types.

methods.javadoc: typeToName() returns the name of a predefined merge type. Only predefined types, as specified in ProgramMergeFilter, will return a name. Otherwise, an empty string is returned. @param type the type of merge difference whose name is wanted. Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA, REFERENCES, SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS, ALL. @return the name of the predefined merge difference type. Otherwise, the empty string.
methods.name: typeToName
methods.comment:
typeToName() returns the name of a predefined merge type.
  Only predefined types, as specified in ProgramMergeFilter, 
  will return a name. Otherwise, an empty string is returned.

params.name: type
params.comment:
the type of merge difference whose name is wanted.
 Valid types are: BYTES, INSTRUCTIONS, DATA, REFERENCES,
 SYMBOLS, PRIMARY_SYMBOL, COMMENTS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT, PROPERTIES, BOOKMARKS, FUNCTIONS, ALL.

return.comment:
the name of the predefined merge difference type. 
 Otherwise, the empty string.

methods.javadoc: filterToName returns the string associated with an individual (primary) merge difference setting. @param type the type of filter. Valid types are: IGNORE, REPLACE, MERGE. @return the string indicating the merge difference setting.
methods.name: filterToName
methods.comment:
filterToName returns the string associated with an
 individual (primary) merge difference setting.

params.name: type
params.comment:
the type of filter.
 Valid types are: IGNORE, REPLACE, MERGE.

return.comment: the string indicating the merge difference setting.

methods.name: equals
methods.comment:
Determines whether or not this filter is equal to the object that
 is passed in.

params.name: obj
params.comment: the object to compare this one with.

return.comment: true if the filter matches this one.

name: ProgramMergeFilter
comment:
The ProgramMergeFilter is used to specify which portions of a 
 program should be merged into another program.
 It indicates the types of program differences to merge. 
 Each merge type can have its filter set to IGNORE or REPLACE.
 IGNORE indicates no interest in replacing or merging that type of difference.
 REPLACE indicates to replace differences in program1 with differences of 
 that type from program2.
 Some merge types (for example, COMMENTS and SYMBOLS) allow the filter to be 
 set to MERGE.
 MERGE indicates that the type should
 be taken from Program2 and merged into Program1 with whatever is alreaady there.

fields.javadoc: Indicates the merge filter difference type specified was not valid.
fields.name: INVALID
fields.comment: Indicates the merge filter difference type specified was not valid.

fields.javadoc: IGNORE is a filter value indicating that the type of difference isn't to be changed in the merged program.
fields.name: IGNORE
fields.comment:
IGNORE is a filter value indicating that the type of difference isn't to
 be changed in the merged program.

fields.javadoc: REPLACE is a filter value indicating that the type of difference in program1 should be replaced with the difference from program2.
fields.name: REPLACE
fields.comment:
REPLACE is a filter value indicating that the type of difference in program1
 should be replaced with the difference from program2.

fields.name: MERGE

Indicates the merge filter for the instruction code unit differences.
